title: banned for apparent inting.

replies.body:
The system that punishes for gameplay generally errs on the side of not risking false positives. In other words, if the system has triggered for inting, there is no or only a smidgeon of doubt that there was intentional feeding occurring in that game.

That's not to say that false positives don't happen, because no system is perfect, but they are very rare.

As for the game in question, this is purely personal observations from looking at the match history. Getting 23 deaths isn't *impossible* without intent feeding, especially with an assassin on the enemy team (arguably 2 if you count Kai'sa), but having 22 CS over a 35 min game, when your *melee* support managed 76 is more than a little suspect. Even if he was stealing CS (which to any serious degree would be pointless with the support item) that is an extremely low value.

Regardless, player support is the means to appeal your punishment. If you feel your concerns were not adequately addressed you can respond to the ticket. If you want proper community review, then you will have to post your full reform card and your full tickets. We have limited pieces of a whole puzzle here.
